Key Takeaways         SEO Imperative for Dentists Dental SEO is essential for dental practices because it increases online visibility, which is crucial for attracting new patients. Maximizing Online Visibility: Expert SEO Solutions for Dental Practices  Are you looking to grow your dental practice and attract more patients? Do you feel tired of relying on word-of-mouth referrals for new clients? You’re in the right place!  At KickStart Dental Marketing, we understand how hard it can be to break into the digital world, especially with so many other local businesses competing for attention online. That’s why our team remains dedicated to helping clients like you develop powerful dental SEO strategies that boost their visibility in search engine results pages (SERPs). We use cutting-edge tactics and best practices to ensure you stand out. With our help, you’ll get more traffic, build brand awareness, and generate leads from qualified prospects who actively search for a dental practice just like yours!  What’s Search Engine Optimization (SEO)?  When you type a query into a search engine like Google, it scours millions of web pages for the most relevant and up-to-date content related to that query. SEO is the practice of optimizing pages to appear higher on SERPs. You can think of it as a way of helping people find your dental practice website more easily whenever they look up related content. The higher it ranks, the better chance it has of getting seen — and with our help, you can ensure prospective patients will notice you first.  Do You Need Dental SEO?  Studies show that the top five Google search results account for 68% of all clicks. What does this mean? If you don’t appear in the first few positions on SERPs, then there’s a good chance potential patients will keep choosing other dental practices over yours. With our familiarity with the dental industry and technical SEO expertise, we can dramatically improve your visibility and get more qualified leads. Just imagine what it would be like to have hundreds of new visitors on your dental practice’s website every month!  What You Can Expect From Dental Search Engine Optimization  At KickStart Dental Marketing, we have years of experience helping dentists make their mark on the online directory. Research and Auditing  Dental practices have different needs, so we start every project with a thorough consultation. Do you have an existing dental website? How many new patients do you get on average per month? We’ll review your current online presence and look into the competition to see what they’re doing right — or wrong. Then, our dental SEO experts will use this knowledge to develop a custom strategy for you.  Dental SEO  With a better understanding of your local business, we will improve your website to rank higher. Our plan of action includes the following steps:  Streamlining the website structure to enhance navigation Fixing technical issues that may be hindering your SERP position Optimizing images, videos, and other media to ensure fast loading times And more  Not only will you score favorably with Google’s search results, but users will also take notice of your website’s user-friendly design. You can think of it as your digital dental office. Wouldn’t it be nice to give a good first impression to new patients?  Keyword Phrase Planning for Search Engines  What exactly are relevant keywords? They’re short phrases people type into a search engine to look for local services. Our team will help you identify potential topics and keywords related to your dental services so they appear more frequently in SERPs. In addition to short-tail related keywords, we recommend long-tail keywords, which consist of longer phrases with lower competition but still improve your SEO score. Our techs can determine optimal variations and place them appropriately within your website’s content for maximum effect.  Content Marketing  Creating high-quality content is essential for keeping website visitors engaged and returning for more. Our team can create blog posts, infographics, and other dentistry-related articles. We’ll also make them “SEO friendly,” meaning they’ll rank high on search engines without sacrificing quality. Our team believes in producing local SEO content with value, so we use only the best copywriters.  Off-page Local SEO Services  All the strategies we have mentioned involve on-page SEO, which optimizes your website to boost search engine rankings. Off-page SEO for dentists, on the other hand, focuses on improving your reputation and authority online. We can do this through the following:   Social media marketing. Top social media sites like Facebook and Twitter can help your dental practice rank higher in more Google searches to gain new patients. We’ll update your Google Business Profile and create social media campaigns to maximize patient acquisition. Link building. Local SEO backlinks, or links from other influential dental websites pointing to your own, help strengthen your position in search engines. We’ll research potential dentist SEO link sources and outreach to high-authority webpages in the industry. Reviews and testimonials. Online reviews are essential for a dental practice, as people use them to decide which practices to check out. We’ll include calls to action on your dental website and social media pages so past customers can easily leave reviews. Guest posting. Depending on your dental practice goals, we may also explore the possibility of guest posting and contributing content to other websites and online directories in return for a mention.   Dental SEO Results Analysis and Reporting  Our process doesn’t end once your site reaches the first page of search results. All these efforts give us a better picture of your dental practice’s web presence and help us re-strategize as needed.  Why Partner With Our Dental SEO Agency?  At KickStart Dental Marketing, we ensure your dental practice stays ahead of the curve. Our team boasts SEO experts and social media copywriters who understand the dental trade and its markets. Technology advances ever so rapidly, and online trends come and go. We keep our finger on the pulse, so we can adjust our services as needed and ride the waves of digital marketing.  Since SEO-related strategies typically require a few months to show results, we encourage clients to work with us on a long-term basis. However, as every dental practice is unique, our experts are happy to tailor local SEO plans according to your budget and needs. For example, Google ads and other pay-per-click campaigns can speed up the process and help you gain a competitive edge.  Take Your Dental Practice to the Next Level Today  Online visibility is more important than ever for dentists in today’s digital world. If your practice doesn’t see as much success as it used to, or you want to reach a larger audience, investing in dental SEO is the best strategy available to you, and we’re the pros when it comes to implementing it for the dental industry. SEO, or Search Engine Optimization, is the process of optimizing a website to rank higher in search engine results. How does SEO attract more patients to my dental practice? SEO increases your website’s visibility in search engine results. When your site ranks higher, it’s more likely to be seen by potential patients searching for dental services. column5: Google Ads for Dentists That Get Results

Digital marketing is more complex than it appears initially. Without professional assistance, it can become a frustrating trial-and-error process with a steep learning curve. Cut to the head of the class by partnering with Kickstart Dental Marketing.

column1: Our experienced team will help you create winning Google ads campaigns that drive qualified leads to your site.

column5: Why Choose a Google Ads Campaign?

Google ranks as the world’s largest search engine, blowing the competition out of the water. The phrase “google it” gives clear evidence of the search engine’s popularity. If you choose to advertise with the site, you become part of a machine that drives almost seven billion searches every day.

column1: You don’t, however, need that search volume to be successful, and this is where Google search ups the ante for your dental PPC campaign. You can create online marketing campaigns tailored to every new patient in your target audience.

By targeting the correct search term, creating an enticing ad, and ensuring landing page relevance, you can create a winning PPC advertising campaign. Best of all, you pay for results—but only if someone clicks on your ad through to your business profile.

column5: How Google Search Ads Work
With Google AdWords for dentists, you target specific search terms or keywords. You then bid on how much you will pay when someone takes action on your ad. You can opt to pay for:

column1: Views of your Google ads campaign
Click through rate
Clickthroughs to your dental clinic landing pages

Sounds simple, doesn’t it? In reality, however, you must compete with every other dentist in the area using the same technique. If they word their ads better or pay more per bid, their ads will appear more often.

It’s here that experience becomes invaluable in optimizing your ad campaign without blowing your budget. To better understand this, it helps to know how Google determines the best answer for a search query. The algorithm considers the searcher’s:
Location
Browsing history
Intent

Google will then display the ads for dental patients above the search results. This shows how search engines can drive more traffic to your site. You can, therefore, improve the advertising of your dentistry practice with keyword research.

column5: Starting Your First Google Campaign

You can easily create a Google ad with the instructions on-site. The downside, however, is that finding the best keywords to target for ads may prove difficult. You can use the Google Keyword Tool to get ideas of search terms and volumes, but this can be tricky.

column1: Ideally, you want a low-competition keyword with enough search volume to make it worthwhile. In such cases, it pays to be specific with Google ads. Try something like “endodontist in Windemere, Orlando,” rather than “dental practices in Orlando, Florida.”
Why?

The goal here aims to create ads to entice new patients. While many more searches occur for a dentist than an endodontist, broad targeting ads may be a waste of money if you have a specialist practice.
Our team works with Google every day and knows how to get results with every ad. Don’t waste time trying to figure it out for yourself when you can better spend that time treating your patients.
Examples of keywords we might target in your ad include the following:
Local Dentist
Dental Practices
Family Dentist
Orthodontist
Dental Treatment
Emergency Dentist
Dental Implants

We can narrow it down further by explaining the type of dentist, for example, cosmetic dentist. Then we can take your ad a step further by adding the area you serve to ensure the ad brings feet through the door.

column5: Should You Target More Than One Area in Your Ads?

This depends on which areas of your community you serve. See where most of your customers or ideal customers live and target those areas. You can encompass other areas in your ad if you believe that clients will drive to your clinic.

column1: The concept here is to improve your pool of potential leads but still be realistic. If your office is located in Orlando, showing up in an ad at the top of a Google page in Brisbane, Australia, will not offer any useful leads for you. You need clients within driving distance. You can select cities, neighborhoods, regions, or zip codes.

column5: Set Your Budget for Google Ads

Another useful feature of Google Ads includes making it difficult to overspend. You select your bid and your maximum budget. You can either choose to spend a set amount daily or opt for a certain number of clicks. When you reach either limit, your ads stop for the day.

column1: A good rule of thumb involves aiming for about five to ten clicks daily. We recommend running your campaign for at least three to four weeks.

column5: Is That All You Need To Do for Dental Practice Google Ads?

Creating an ad for your dental office gives you a good start, but is it the best way to attract attention to your business profile? The answer is that the only way to know for sure may require tweaking the ad.

column1: You will now run split ad tests in which you change one thing in the ad. You can, for example, vary the call to action slightly or change where you place the keywords. You’ll run both Google ads simultaneously to see which performs better with your target audience.

column5: Does This Strategy Work for Any Dental Practice Landing Page?

Yes, you pay for results, so Google ads ensure that it positions your advertisement in an optimal spot. Achieving the same kind of positioning through on-site SEO is not only extremely challenging but also difficult to maintain.

column1: PPC for dentists offers a simpler option, but it can be challenging to manage if you run a busy dental practice. The results also depend on the quality of your landing page. With the right focus on your dental practice and dental services, however, your Google ad campaign will be successful.

column5: How We Advertise You as a Dentist Using Google Ads

Setting up a simple campaign is easy enough, and it will generate some results. However, if you want to optimize those results with a minimal budget, you need to use the “Expert Mode.” This unlocks several valuable features, which require some expertise to use.

Video

Campaigns

column5: Google Advanced Keyword Research and Search Ads

We shine in identifying the right balance of keywords to attract the patients who need and can afford your services. Some dentists start by trying to outbid other users. While this broad targeting strategy will boost traffic, it becomes expensive very quickly.

column1: Our team identifies the best value-for-money keywords and phrases, and then we take them to the next level. We look for high-value, low-volume key phrases to minimize your expenses.

For example, instead of targeting “dentists in Orlando, FL,” we might target “dental implants in Orlando, FL.” We use tools such as the Google Ads Keyword Planner Tool to correctly identify the right phrases and predict search volumes.

column5: Negative Keywords and Your Google Ads Campaign

While key phrases are important, you will find it just as critical to avoid negative keywords. For example, if you want to advertise that you offer braces. Using the term braces might, however, also bring up back braces. That result won’t be useful at all, so you can use the term “back” as a negative keyword.
